--- In gladiator@y..., "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@y...> 
wrote:
> I waited over 1 hour to convert my scenario 401 (bonus) into text.  
It 
> has 8000 objects in it.  It still wasn't through.  It took about 5 
> minutes for the program to process scenario 131 of my set and it has 
> only 412 objects.  I am going to have to speed up the code, or put a 
> warning out there.
> 
> let me see 400 * 20 = 8000, and 5 * 20 = 100.  Hmm.  It might take 
> around 100 minutes to put that scenario in text.  That's almost 2 
> hours and unacceptable.  I definitely am going to try to speed up 
that 
> code somehow.

I waited almost 3 hours and it didn't finish displaying the 
information in the text.

While trying to speed the program up, I found an error in the 
Microsoft's programming: a function that is supposed to determine the 
length of a file gives incorrect values or I could get the whole 
process done within 2 minutes on my PC because it takes less than 1 
minute to put all the information in a file.
